scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains forty-eight short, holograph, early sketches, jokes, poems, and dialogues from Porter's time in Austin, Texas. 1894-1895, when he was producing copy for his humorous weekly The Rolling Stone, most of which he wrote, illustrated, and edited himself. The Rolling Stone was in publication for only a brief time of 56 weeks and 48 issues and Porter contributed heavily to it while also working full-time at the First National Bank of Austin. The typed descriptions with each piece were supplied by the dealer.
